alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 14 at 3:36AM PST until December 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE ALISAL BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over burn scars. Rainfall rates locally up to one inch per hour will be possible. * WHERE...The Alisal burn scar in Santa Barbara County * WHEN...Until Noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and debris flows in and around this recent burn scar. Roads may be impacted or closed and vehicles may be stranded. Localized damage to structures and campgrounds is possible. Residents near these burn scars should prepare for potential flash flooding and debris flow impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding and debris flows. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast
